title.narrative: 5.7 CROSS-CUTTING (ADAP, CFLG & C4D)

description.narrative: Cross Cutting:ADAP, CFLG and Communication for Development (C4D): Improved capacity of National and local government systems and other key stakeholders (especially children, adolescents, youth, families, NGOs and media) to promote disaster risk reduction, climate change adaptation and resilience building in earthquake affected areas., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By Dec 2017, early recovery and reconstruction efforts will enhance the national and local capacities to a quicker transition in achieving more sustainable outcomes for children and women in the 14 highly affected Earthquake districts with a focus on building resilience, strengthening systems, capacity building and increasing local and national ownership.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Cross Cutting:ADAP, CFLG and C4D: Improved capacity of National and local government systems and other key stakeholders(especially children, adolescents, youth, families, NGOs and media) to promote disaster risk reduction, climate change adaptationand resilience building in earthquake affected areas.

description.narrative: Community-based communication and social mobilization interventions to promote disaster risk reduction and issues like safe migration and child participation reached over 32,000 adolescents and youth helping them become resilient to future disasters and advocates of child rights issues. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: People in severely affected districts are reached with critical life-saving information

actual.value: 2015:Met. 1,000,000 people (100% of target) in severely affected districts were reached with critical life-saving information.

title.narrative: Number of child club networks/adolescents/youth /media personnel capacitated to promote local planning processes, DRR ,climate change adaptation and resilience building (Note: baseline and end-line should be separated for CFLG (child club network), ADAP (Rupantaran)) and C4D

target.value: 2017:7000 children and youth capacitated, 200 community media persons trained

actual.value: 2017:32,798 children, adolescents and youth were capacitated on local planning processes, social and financial skills for resilience building, life-skills focusing on stress management, communication and social mobilisation skills focusing on DRR, unsafe migration and human trafficking and forum theatre.

title.narrative: Number of local bodies and frontline workers capacitated to mainstream child friendly resilience plan as per the national strategy on child friendly local governance and block grant guidelines

target.value: 2017:516 VDC Secretaries, 593 social mobilisers, 34 municipality officers, 25 DDC officers

actual.value: 2017:450 government officials, 1015 elected representatives of local government and 1,839 frontline workers were capacitated on child friendly resilience planning

title.narrative: Number of community feedbacks collected, analysed and disseminated.

target.value: 2017:50 community feedback reports collected from 5 districts

actual.value: 2017:Knowledge and perception survey completed (494 forms collected and analyzed). Second round of feedback collection (494 forms) is completed and the analysis is ongoing

title.narrative: Number of districts with a roster of trained youth volunteers with detailed skill profile for climate change adaptation and disaster risk reduction

actual.value: 2017:This activity has been put on hold based on discussion with National Planning Commission and Ministry of Youth and Sports due to the possible changes in structures because of recent federalization.

title.narrative: Number of adolescents, youth and community groups engaged in community action and local planning processes in relation to DRR, climate change adaptation and resilience building

target.value: 2017:7,000 youth and children, 400 community-based groups and 2,412 children engaged

actual.value: 2017:32,798 children, adolescents and youth were engaged in local planning processes, forum theatre, interactive group discussions on local pertinent issues and community level awareness raising activities. Over 12,000 community members were reached through interactive group discussions on the issues of

title.narrative: Technical support to 12 districts on Disaster Risk Management (preparedness and capacity building)

actual.value: 2017:A total of 881 including 286 women and 239 children oriented on DRR and CCA in Dolakha and Dhading districts.

title.narrative: Number of Disaster Risk Management Plan (DDMPs) developed and DRR programme implementation in 2 selected districts out of EQ 14 districts (i.e. Dolakha and Dhading)

actual.value: 2017:DDMP completed and waiting for the endorsement from District Councils in Dolakha and Dhading districts.
